content:
Diagnosis:	Advanced non-small cell lung cancer T4N3M1a (contralateral lung metastases)
		Adenocarcinoma with confirmed EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion)
		PD-L1 expression 1%

Treatment:	15.03.2023: Commenced osimertinib 80mg daily
		Initial CT assessment shows partial response after 2 cycles

Current:	Completing month 6 of targeted therapy

[redacted name] returns for routine follow-up while receiving EGFR-targeted therapy.

Symptoms:
? Progressive skin rash affecting face and upper trunk, grade 2 severity
? Intermittent diarrhea (2-3 episodes daily)
? Mild paronychia affecting both thumbs
? Occasional dry cough, improved from baseline
? Reduced exercise tolerance but able to manage daily activities
? Early satiety with 3kg weight loss over 2 months
? Persistent fatigue requiring afternoon rest
? Mild peripheral edema
? No hemoptysis
? No chest pain

Current Medications:
Osimertinib 80mg daily
Doxycycline 100mg daily for rash
Loperamide as required
Levothyroxine 75mcg daily

Performance Status = 1

Examination:
? Papulopustular rash affecting face and upper chest
? Mild paronychia of thumbnails
? No peripheral lymphadenopathy
? Chest clear on auscultation
? O2 saturation 96% on air
? Heart rate 88 regular
? Temperature 37.2Â°C
? Blood pressure 128/76
? Mild bilateral ankle edema
? No clinical evidence of disease progression

Recent Investigations:
Blood tests show stable biochemistry and mild normocytic anemia
CT thorax (10.08.2023) demonstrates maintained partial response with reduction in primary mass and stable contralateral nodules

Plan:
? Continue osimertinib at current dose
? Increase doxycycline to twice daily for rash management
? Dietary advice given for diarrhea control
? Review in 4 weeks with repeat blood tests
? CT reassessment scheduled for November 2023

cancer_timeline.value: Initial CT assessment shows partial response after 2 cycles
CT thorax demonstrates maintained partial response with reduction in primary mass and stable contralateral nodules

patient_facts.value: Progressive skin rash affecting face and upper trunk, grade 2 severity
Papulopustular rash affecting face and upper chest
Blood tests show stable biochemistry and mild normocytic anemia

status_updates.value: Advanced EGFR-mutant lung cancer showing maintained partial response to osimertinib after 6 months of therapy, with manageable toxicities including grade 2 rash requiring dose escalation of supportive medications.
maintained partial response with reduction in primary mass and stable contralateral nodules
grade 2 skin rash requiring increased doxycycline dosing
Review in 4 weeks with repeat blood tests
